quoteFirst: The land passed yesterday and the day before is a group of islands, 14 or 16 in number, lying between the latitude of 16 degrees 26 minutes south and 17 degrees 57 minutes south, and in longitude by my account 4 degrees
quoteLast: degrees 17 minutes west from Tofoa. Three of these islands are very large, having from 30 to 40 leagues of sea-coast.
title: A voyage to the South Sea
author: Bligh, William, 1754-1817

quoteFirst: The setting sun now throws but slanting rays upon the bosom of the ocean. It must be about six o'clock in the evening. I take out my watch and it marks
title: Facing the Flag
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905
